p: For each species, the seroconversion rate with 95% confidence interval was plotted over time as the derivative of the kernel-smoothed Nelson-Aalen cumulative hazard estimator, using a 60-day kernel width. For this purpose, instead of the midpoint-imputed seroconversion date used above, a randomly selected date between the last negative and first positive test was used for seroconverting animals in order to avoid systematic bias in incidence rate estimation over time [ 47]. All statistical analyses were done using Stata 15 (StataCorp, College Station, TX, U.S.A.) and statistical significance was assessed at P<0.05. Risk surfaces for seroprevalence and seroconversion rate in the study area were created by interpolation using ordinary kriging in ArcGIS 10.2 (Esri, Redlands, CA, U.S.A.).
